title: What programming positions are best for people with learning disabilities? - Quora

response.answer_text: Any position that allows you to program in a simple, easy-to-learn language such as Python or Smalltalk. I highly recommend Smalltalk: see Richard Eng's answer to What is the best programming language to learn? Smalltalk has virtually no syntax! This makes it really, really easy to learn. It was designed for teaching programming to children, after all. Of course, my answer depends a great deal on the extent of one’s learning disabilities. If those disabilities are severe, then programming in general will be impossible. Programming is hard. There’s no getting around this fact.
“Learning disabilities” is such a broad topic… please be a bit more specific.
